diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: Astronaut. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: almaMater - Example triple: (Alan Bean | almaMater | "UT Austin, B.S. 1955")
Predicate: birthDate - Example triple: (Alan Bean | birthDate | "1932-03-15")
Predicate: birthName - Example triple: (Alan Bean | birthName | "Alan LaVern Bean")
Predicate: birthPlace - Example triple: (Alan Bean | birthPlace | Wheeler, Texas)
Predicate: dateOfRetirement - Example triple: (Alan Bean | dateOfRetirement | "June 1981")
Predicate: occupation - Example triple: (Alan Bean | occupation | Test pilot)
Predicate: status - Example triple: (Alan Bean | status | "Retired")
Predicate: timeInSpace - Example triple: (Alan Bean | timeInSpace | "100305.0"(minutes))
Predicate: mission - Example triple: (Alan Bean | mission | Apollo 12)
Predicate: selectedByNasa - Example triple: (Alan Bean | selectedByNasa | 1963)
Predicate: deathDate - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | deathDate | "1998-07-21")
Predicate: nationality - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | nationality | United States)
Predicate: servedAsChiefOfTheAstronautOfficeIn - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | servedAsChiefOfTheAstronautOfficeIn | 1963)
Predicate: title - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | title | Chief of the Astronaut Office)
Predicate: ribbonAward - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | ribbonAward | "American Defense Service ribbon.svg")
Predicate: operator - Example triple: (Apollo 11 | operator | NASA)
Predicate: backupPilot - Example triple: (Apollo 12 | backupPilot | Alfred Worden)
Predicate: commander - Example triple: (Apollo 12 | commander | David Scott)
Predicate: crewMembers - Example triple: (Apollo 8 | crewMembers | Frank Borman)
Predicate: representative - Example triple: (British Hong Kong | representative | Chris Patten)
Predicate: alternativeName - Example triple: (Buzz Aldrin | alternativeName | "Edwin E. Aldrin, Jr.")
Predicate: awards - Example triple: (Buzz Aldrin | awards | 20)
Predicate: fossil - Example triple: (California | fossil | Smilodon)
Predicate: senators - Example triple: (California | senators | Dianne Feinstein)
Predicate: part - Example triple: (Dallas | part | Collin County, Texas)
Predicate: partsType - Example triple: (Dallas | partsType | List of counties in Texas)
Predicate: higher - Example triple: (Distinguished Service Medal (United States Navy) | higher | Department of Commerce Gold Medal)
Predicate: isPartOf - Example triple: (Glen Ridge, New Jersey | isPartOf | Essex County, New Jersey)
Predicate: bird - Example triple: (New Hampshire | bird | Purple finch)
Predicate: leader - Example triple: (St. Louis | leader | Francis G. Slay)
Predicate: affiliation - Example triple: (University of Texas at Austin | affiliation | University of Texas System)
Predicate: competeIn - Example triple: (University of Texas at Austin | competeIn | Big 12 Conference)
Predicate: president - Example triple: (University of Texas at Austin | president | Gregory L. Fenves)
Predicate: award - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | award | Distinguished Service Medal (United States Navy))
Predicate: deathPlace - Example triple: (Alan Shepard | deathPlace | California)
Predicate: gemstone - Example triple: (California | gemstone | Benitoite)
Predicate: mascot - Example triple: (University of Texas at Austin | mascot | Hook 'em (mascot))
Predicate: cosparId - Example triple: (Shenzhou 10 | cosparId | 2013-029A)
Predicate: utcOffset - Example triple: (Zaoyang | utcOffset | +8)

```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    sentences = []
    subject_data = {}

    for triple in triples:
        predicate = triple.predicate
        subject = triple.subject
        object_val = triple.object

        if subject not in subject_data:
            subject_data[subject] = []
        subject_data[subject].append((predicate, object_val))

    for subject, data in subject_data.items():
        sentence = f"{subject} "
        facts = []
        for predicate, object_val in data:
            if predicate == "almaMater":
                facts.append(f"attended {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "birthDate":
                facts.append(f"was born on {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "birthPlace":
                facts.append(f"was born in {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "dateOfRetirement":
                facts.append(f"retired in {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "occupation":
                facts.append(f"worked as a {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "status":
                facts.append(f"has status {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "timeInSpace":
                facts.append(f"spent {object_val} in space")
            elif predicate == "mission":
                facts.append(f"participated in the {object_val} mission")
            elif predicate == "selectedByNasa":
                facts.append(f"was selected by NASA in {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "deathDate":
                facts.append(f"passed away on {object_val}")
            elif predicate == "nationality":
                facts.append(f"was of {object_val} nationality")
            # Add more predicates as needed

        if facts:
            sentence += ", ".join(facts) + "."
            sentences.append(sentence)

    return " ".join(sentences)

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
```
